title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 August 2015 - XWiki
content:

11:15 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol1> today is our last day to finish the M3 release and be able to releae on Monday  
11:16 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:16 <vmassol> we need to finish the remaining issues  +fix the ci  
11:16 <vmassol> mflorea: what's your ETA?  
11:17 <vmassol> 6 issues open in total  
11:18 <vmassol> 3 marius, 2 edy, 1 guillaume  
11:18 <vmassol> Enygma`: what's your ETA too?  
11:18 <vmassol> (on your 2 issues)  
11:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm finishing now (say 1h) and then I'll start looking at the failing tests. Note that the copy/rename operations are still synchronous. I've added the ability to select the target document using the tree, but we still need to make the operation async and display the progress bar.  
11:27 <vmassol> mflorea: do we need this for 7.2?  
11:27 <mflorea> we'll do this as a next step, either before 7.2 final or after, depending if it's important  
11:28 <mflorea> the only problem is when you copy/rename a document with losts of nested docs  
11:28 <mflorea> i.e. it takes time and you don't see the progress  
11:29 <vmassol> yes it's definitely a usability issue  
11:30 <mflorea> yes, but it's visible when you perform a big refactoring  
11:30 <vmassol> yes  
11:31 <mflorea> it shouldn't be hard to add the progress bar. Guillaume added it for the delete operation. We can do the same for the copy/rename  
11:32 <mflorea> for copy/rename it's even easier because the operation is triggered from a Velocity template, not from oldcore (e.g. DeleteAction) so easier to modify (nothing to compile)  
11:33 <vmassol> ok if we can do it in RC2 then good  
11:33 <vmassol> RC1  
11:33 <mflorea> ok, I'll create the jira issue  
11:33 <vmassol> k  
11:34 <vmassol> Enygma`: what's your ETA on your 2 issues for M3?  
11:36 <mflorea> re XWIKI-12176, I've created a document "picker" that is used by the create/copy/rename UI to select the target document, but for view mode we've just used the breadcrumb. i.e. the document "displayer" in view mode is the #hierarchy($doc) macro.  
11:37 <mflorea> this works fine for the create/copy/rename UI when we display the source document, but it may not be good for the live table for instance  
11:37 <vmassol> ok then we neeed a new jira issue maybe for the remaining work?  
11:38 <vmassol> found a bug with wiki macros in nested spaces when you restart xwiki, debugging  
11:38 <mflorea> yes, for the view part, but we need to decide if we want to reuse the breacrumb to display a document location (in a livetable for instance) or something else  
11:39 <vmassol> evalica: do you want to take that investigation?  
11:41 <vmassol> ok found the problem for wiki macros, fixing  
11:41 <evalica> vmassol: talking to Marius to see the problem  
11:45 <vmassol> k  
11:54 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <Enygma`> vmassol:  the create action UI is done, Marius will commit his latest changes, so I`m left with XWIKI-12320 that I`m looking into today  
12:07 <vmassol> ok  
12:27 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:27 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
12:29 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <vmassol> hmm  
12:39 <vmassol> I canno't create a subwiki on master  
12:39 <vmassol> hmm no  
12:40 <vmassol> it's still running and it's solr failing  
12:40 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/90d22dfb678c8e422ef0/raw/36d035e90b81bfe35ccb8b7552820d8269fa8197/gistfile1.txt  
12:41 <vmassol> note: I had a breakpoint I didn't notice so that's why it was not progressing  
12:41 <vmassol> still reveals some issue with the solr indexing happening too early or something like that  
12:44 <vmassol> actually I've restested and it's not a problem of speed  
12:44 <vmassol> I always get the SOLR issue, going to raise an issue  
12:46 <vmassol> Enygma`: could this be caused by some permission change you did: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12453 ?  
12:47 <Enygma`> looking  
12:52 <Enygma`> not sure, since it looks like solr is trying to index a document before the wiki is created  
12:52 <Enygma`> will probably have to debug (and to reproduce first), but brb after lunch  
12:54 <vmassol> in any case it's something new  
12:54 <vmassol> that wasn't there before  
12:55 <vmassol> btw I have a problem with the breadcrumb in the subwiki  
12:56 <vmassol> I see this https://www.evernote.com/l/AHcpTTJCeAZEfJyPV5Hj9GFHf6qb80EJsJc  
12:56 <vmassol> which doesn't look correct  
12:56 <vmassol> notice the repetition of "test"  
12:56 <vmassol> (both point to the same url)

15:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're checking all "select distinct doc.space" ?  
15:16 <vmassol> :)  
15:17 <tmortagne> no, all new DocumentReference(String, String, String) actually but that could be next step yes  
15:22 <tmortagne> hmm totoally forgot to set time for nested spaces related issue recently  
15:22 <tmortagne> s/totoally/totally/  
15:22 <vmassol> yep, seen it  
15:22 <vmassol> but I logged my time and thought it would trigger you to remember it :)  
15:26 <vmassol> hehe Enygma` also got a reminder ;)  
15:26 <Enygma`> :)  
15:28 <vmassol> checking FAQTest failure and why is failing now  
15:28 <vmassol> \*why vp.getMetaDataValue("space") is failing now  
15:28 <vmassol> although I'm sure Enygma` knows why (my guess is that ti's the change done yesterday evening by Guillaume on the js api)  
15:29 <vmassol> ah yes it's been removed apparently  
15:29 <vmassol> ????  
15:29 <vmassol> in rev 423988b717d78ffd5bff051611de2f0374bb9437  
15:29 <vmassol> reverting it  
15:33 <MasterPiece> has quit  
15:33 <Enygma`> I was also wondering about that change... Guillaume removed the info from the DOM since we should use the JS api to get it and not use the DOM directly  
15:33 <vmassol> I know but backward compat!  
15:33 <Enygma`> and even UI tests  
15:33 <vmassol> yes but tests could be modified  
15:34 <vmassol> addig a comment  
15:34 <Enygma`> in terms of backwards compat, I`m not sure that way of getting the info was incouraged before  
15:34 <vmassol> there was no other way :)  
15:34 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
15:35 <vmassol> meta.js didn't exist  
15:35 <Enygma`> there was XWiki.currentSpace  
15:35 <Enygma`> where it got its info from is another discussion :)  
15:35 <vmassol> indeed  
15:35 <vmassol> still  
15:35 <Enygma`> yeah, I know  
15:35 <vmassol> we cannot remove it like this  
15:35 <Enygma`> I refrained from commenting on the change, but I kind of agree  
15:36 <vmassol> well we now have 2 ways then  
15:36 <vmassol> XWiki.currentSpace and meta.js  
15:36 <Enygma`> and XWiki.Document.currentSpace :)  
15:36 <vmassol> :)  
15:36 <Enygma`> since XWiki.currentSpace is deprecated-ish, right?  
15:36 <Enygma`> replaced by XWiki.Document  
15:37 <vmassol> don't ask me, I don't know  
15:37 <vmassol> i just know that the js api is at least as messy as the core :)  
15:38 <vmassol> (joke intended)  
15:38 <Enygma`> :)  
15:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: don'r you find "document-reference" a bit longuish?  
15:43 <vmassol> I'd have used simply "reference"  
15:44 <vmassol> we already have "version" for example and not document-version  
15:44 <vmassol> or documet-rest-url  
15:44 <vmassol> \*document  
15:44 <vmassol> wdyt?  
15:46 <Enygma`> vmassol: yes, that would make sense  
15:46 <Enygma`> the 1.2 export format also uses "reference"  
15:46 <vmassol> ok changing then  
15:46 <Enygma`> ok  
15:53 <martin-h> has quit  
15:54 <vmassol> actually I don't understand something Enygma`  
15:54 <vmassol> in FAQTest we use getMetaDataValue()  
15:54 <vmassol> it means: return getDriver().findElement(By.xpath("//meta[@name='" + metaName + "']")).getAttribute("content");  
15:54 <vmassol> so it's not using the html tag bu some meta tag  
15:55 <martin-h> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <vmassol> these are set in htmlheader.vm below  
15:56 <vmassol> (for colibri)  
15:56 <vmassol> but they don't seem set for flamingo since it uses the html tag  
15:56 <vmassol> so how could the FAQTest work before?  
15:58 <vmassol> our tests run in colibri? I doubt that  
15:58 <vmassol> (I'm sure they don't actually)  
16:06 <vmassol> guys there are still 6 open issuses for M3  
16:06 <vmassol> Enygma`, mflorea: getting closer? :)  
16:07 <vmassol> for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12189 we could open  new issue for RC1  
16:10 <vrachieru> has quit  
16:11 <Slashman> has quit  
16:26 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:38 <vmassol> btw  
16:39 <vmassol> any comment on the breadcrumb issue I reported here earlier  
16:39 <vmassol> anyone who worked on breadcrumb during 7.2M3?  
16:39 <vmassol> Enygma`: did you work on breadcrumb in 7.2M3?  
16:39 <vmassol> maybe you know the problem  
16:41 <vmassol> trying on 7.2M2  
16:42 <vmassol> BTW platform tests are better but sitll 7 failing: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1762/#showFailuresLink  
16:45 <vmassol> ok it's a 7.2M3 issue only (there was no breadcrumb on home pages in M2)  
16:45 <vmassol> so this issue was introduced by either GD or Enygma` :)  
16:46 <vmassol> ok found an issue: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12407  
16:46 <vmassol> commenting in there  
16:48 <Enygma`> vmassol: that`s because you see there: The main wiki (home icon), pretty name of the wiki (which you set the same as the wiki ID) and title of the Main space  
16:49 <Enygma`> XWIKI-12407 just displays the title of the main space  
16:49 <Enygma`> and Marius recently added the wiki pretty name, if you are in a subwiki  
16:49 <vmassol> but the home and the wiki are the same  
16:49 <Enygma`> so, technically, it`s expected behavior  
16:49 <vmassol> so we should only have one or those not 2  
16:50 <Enygma`> home icon is for the main wiki homepage  
16:50 <Enygma`> not the current wiki homepage  
16:50 <vmassol> (home of a subwiki)  
16:50 <Enygma`> I don`t follow  
16:51 <vmassol> when you're on test:Main.WebHome for example  
16:51 <vmassol> the link to the subwiki and the link to Main.WebHome are the same  
16:52 <vmassol> hmm actually they could be different  
16:52 <vmassol> but in 99% of the cases they are the same  
16:52 <Enygma`> you will see: [home icon] / [pretty name of the "test" wiki] / [title of the Main space]  
16:52 <vmassol> and this is the problem  
16:52 <vmassol> yes and if you click one or the other they lead to the same place  
16:52 <vmassol> so that's very confusing  
16:52 <vmassol> same name + smae link  
16:52 <Enygma`> we are reflecting the document hierarchy there  
16:52 <vmassol> not really  
16:53 <vmassol> because  
16:53 <vmassol> wiki home == Main.WebHome by default  
16:53 <vmassol> so it's duplicated  
16:53 <vmassol> anyway let me say it differntly  
16:54 <vmassol> no user will agree that displaying (home icon> > Test > Test) makes sense when on the home page, especially as when they click on Test or Test it leads to the same place  
16:54 <vmassol> so we need something better  
16:54 <Enygma`> the homepage can have a different title  
16:54 <vmassol> (even if technically we think it's correct)  
16:55 <vmassol> it still is the same link!!!  
16:56 <Enygma`> the homepage can be set to anything... that homepage's space webHome can have a different title from the wiki pretty name  
16:56 <Enygma`> we wanted to remove magic from the breadcrumbs  
16:56 <vmassol> i'm really -1  
16:56 <vmassol> when you create a new wiki you get a duplicate  
16:57 <vmassol> which is not understandbale  
16:57 <vmassol> we need something better  
16:57 <vmassol> it looks 100% like a bug  
16:57 <vmassol> (when you're a suer)  
16:57 <Enygma`> when you get to use the wiki you understand why it is like that and work with it  
16:57 <mflorea> vmassol: check the main wiki, you have <Home Icon> / Wiki Home  
16:57 <mflorea> both point to the same thing  
16:58 <Enygma`> in the breadcrumbs you always have the current document`s reference hierarchy  
16:58 <Enygma`> we no longer have the top menu  
16:58 <Enygma`> so we need to have the clear navigation in the breadcrumbs  
16:58 <vmassol> then we should not set the subwiki home page to be named as that subwiki  
16:58 <vmassol> we should use Wiki Home then  
16:59 <vmassol> again from a user POV it's a no go as it is now  
16:59 <Enygma`> see XWIKI-12423  
16:59 <mflorea> yes, for me the issue is that the home page has the name of the wiki  
16:59 <Enygma`> that issue introduced the webhome`s space's title  
16:59 <Enygma`> otherwise the breadcrumbs is not correct  
17:00 <Enygma`> and you end up with home / Welcome ... and welcome is not a top level document  
17:00 <vmassol> ok creating a jira issue to change the a subwiki home page name  
17:00 <vmassol> \*title  
17:02 <Enygma`> to what? :)  
17:04 <vmassol> Wiki Home  
17:04 <mflorea> we should think about this a bit. It's not that bad to see the pretty name of the wiki on the wiki home page (as its title), but indeed this makes the breadcrumb look bad  
17:04 <vmassol> then why not do the same on the main wiki?  
17:04 <vmassol> it's a problem of consistentcy too  
17:06 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12459  
17:07 <Enygma`> then you will have issues for the breadcrumbs of a Nested Document under the "Main" space  
17:07 <Enygma`> [home icon] / subwikiX / Wiki Home / Doc 1 / Doc 2  
17:07 <vmassol> actually I see that if there's no pretty name we use Wiki Home  
17:07 <vmassol> what's wrong with your example Enygma`?  
17:08 <vmassol> you said it was corredct above  
17:08 <Enygma`> if you change the homepage of the wiki  
17:08 <vmassol> (correct to have both the subwiki + home page)  
17:09 <vmassol> if you chang e the home page that'll just change the link of subwikiX right?  
17:09 <vmassol> but it's the same for the main wiki I guess  
17:09 <vmassol> ah I see it's the terminology that causes issue: the "home" in "Wiki Home"?  
17:10 <vmassol> you have the same problem with the main wiki  
17:11 <vmassol> so you want a name that means "Main document"  
17:11 <vmassol> and not "wiki home"  
17:11 <vmassol> right?  
17:12 <vmassol> because wiki home is the wiki part of the rbeadcrumb and not the main space part  
17:12 <Enygma`> the issue I mentioned above is that in [home icon] / subwikiX / Wiki Home / Doc 1 / Doc 2, "subwikiX" will link to the new homepage but  "Wiki Home" will always link to Main.WebHome in the current wiki and it will not be "THE wiki's home"  
17:12 <vmassol> yes that's what I said above I think  
17:12 <Ramona1> has quit  
17:12 <vmassol> so we need the pretty name of the main space  
17:12 <vmassol> instead of "Wiki Home"  
17:14 <vmassol> since we just said that the home is a mapping that can changed to anywhere else  
17:14 <Enygma`> but "Wiki Home" is the pretty name of the Main space  
17:14 <vmassol> whihc is wrong  
17:14 <vmassol> as you said  
17:15 <vmassol> the Main space is not always the wiki home  
17:15 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
17:16 <vmassol> "Welcome" could make sense  
17:16 <cjd> Just checking ScriptRight blocks {{html}} right ?  
17:17 <vmassol> "Main" would be the logical choice but it's not very friendly. "Welcome" as the pretty name of the Main space may be more naturla  
17:17 <vmassol> if we could rename the "main'" space we would rename it to "welcome"  
17:17 <vmassol> but we can't, but we can change the pretty name  
17:17 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <tmortagne> cjd: no  
17:18 <Enygma`> cjd: no  
17:18 <Enygma`> just script macros  
17:19 <cjd> ahh ok so {{html}}<script> is still allowed  
17:19 <tmortagne> it only block Velocity basically  
17:19 <tmortagne> this right is about server side script  
17:19 <vmassol> cjd: AFAIR thomzs delafosse worked on taht  
17:19 <vmassol> \*thomas  
17:19 <vmassol> I don't remember if he committed it or not in the end, I think he did  
17:19 <tmortagne> cleaning html content is a different subject and yes thomas worked on that  
17:20 <tmortagne> no I don't think he commected anything on that subject  
17:20 <cjd> yeah but you can't exactly break {{html clean="false"}}  
17:20 <vmassol> I remember seeing the code but maybe it was in a PR only  
17:20 <tmortagne> cjd: I'm not talking abaout clean=false  
17:20 <tmortagne> i'm talking about cleaning html in general  
17:20 <cjd> ok, you're talking about stripping  <script> and onload, onreadystatechange, on\* attributes  
17:21 <vmassol> yep  
17:21 <vmassol> thomas delafosse did an impl of that  
17:21 <tmortagne> things like this yes, that's what thomas tried to do  
17:21 <vmassol> based on tagsup if I recall right  
17:21 <cjd> I'm writing a reply to James to try to explain the situation WRT $doc.save()  
17:22 <vmassol> ah foud it  
17:22 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7878  
17:23 <vmassol> hmm that's anderas  
17:23 <vmassol> \*andreas  
17:23 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7878 is not about html  
17:24 <tmortagne> it's about indicating that you don't want to execute script macro and html macro completely  
17:24 <vmassol> yes indeed  
17:24 <tmortagne> it's XDOM level cleaning basically  
17:24 <vmassol> strange I can'tfind any open PR from Thomas  
17:24 <vmassol> (about this)  
17:24 <vmassol> there are 4 open but they're about something else  
17:24 <tmortagne> I'm not sure he had time to do one  
17:24 <vmassol> I'm sure he did something  
17:24 <vmassol> I remember reviewing the code  
17:25 <tmortagne> he worked on it yes but I don't think he finished  
17:25 <vmassol> yes maybe he didn't do a pr  
17:34 <vmassol> we need someone assigned to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12457 ?  
17:34 <vmassol> (if it's to be fixed in M3)  
18:01 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
18:08 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:20 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:26 <cjd> vmassol: thanks for your comments on video macro, I've logged a todo item to take care of that
